name: (1E)-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3193
Reason: 1E-N,N'-bis(4-methylphenyl)-2-[(4-methylphenyl)amino]ethanimidamide has a complex structure with multiple functional groups. Starting with the basic unit of ethanimidamide, which has a melting point of around 100°C. The methylphenyl group (C)cc1ccccc1 adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The 4-methylphenyl group (C)ccccc1 adds more rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +30°C. The amino group introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10°C. The methyl group (C)ccccc1 reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular volume, estimated at around -10°C. The piperidine ring (Nc1ccc(C)cc1) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at around +20°C. The methylene bridge (Nc1ccc(C)cc1) reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and increased molecular volume, estimated at around -10°C.
